Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 56th overall pick, by Syracuse in 1971...
Injured on 8/4/1971 with a Tender Shoulder, out for one week...
Injured on 8/31/1971 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for 4 days...
Traded from Syracuse to Northeastern on 7/7/1974 (Going to SYR: P J. Fleites, C T. Linnane. Going to NE: C C. Herrero, P D. Pardo, LF D. Castillo)...
Earned first career win on 9/14/1975...
Had first career hit on 4/7/1976, off Darrell Muldoon (Min)...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/7/1977, winning 2 games with a 1.00 ERA...
Hit first career homerun on 8/4/1977, off Pedro Segarra (Min)...
Signed as a free agent by Longport on 2/2/1981 to a 5-year deal worth $2,455,656 per year...
Was selected to the 1982 Allstar game...
